text_preprocessing_utilities module

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.get_lowercase_words_from_str(val)[source]

Extract only lowercase words from str (e.g. ‘one’, ‘house’ from ‘one-house’, without ‘-’ or other characters)

Parameters:

val – string

Returns:

list with all lower case words

Return type:

built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.get_rare_tokens(dict_of_freq, threshold)[source]

Get all values that have a frequency smaller than a threshold

Parameters:

  • lists_of_tokens – dictionary of frequency

  • threshold – a value of comparison

Returns:

a new dictionary that contains just the frequency’s smaller than the threshold

Return type:

built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.get_spacy_tokens_from_raw_text(text, nlp_model)[source]

Convert a raw text to a built-in python list of spacy.tokens.token.Token object (tokens);

Parameters:

  • text – the input text; it’s a native python string

  • nlp_model – NLP model that is used to preprocess the text; it’s a spacy.lang object

Returns:

list of words extracted from the input text

Return type:

built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.get_str_stopwords()[source]

Function that creates the list of stopwords (we exclude certain words that will not be considered stopwords) :return: list of str tokens that represent stopwords :rtype: build-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.get_str_tokens_freq(tokens)[source]

Get the frequency of the tokens given as param

Parameters:

tokens – list of str tokens

Returns:

a dictionary that has as key the token and as value the frequency

Return type:

built-in python dictionary

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.get_str_tokens_freq_for_lists(lists_of_tokens)[source]

Get the frequency of a lists of tokens

Parameters:

lists_of_tokens – lists of str tokens ([[], [], …])

Returns:

a dictionary that has as key the token and as value the frequency from all lists

Return type:

built-in python dictionary

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.handle_rare_str_tokens(tokens, dict_of_freq, replace_with='[UNK]')[source]

Filter tokens by eliminating rare tokens

Parameters:

  • tokens – list of tokens

  • dict_of_freq – dictionary of tokens frequency

  • replace_with – token value for replacement (if None, remove tokens, else replace with given value)

Returns:

filtered list of tokens without items in dictionary

Return type:

built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.is_6digits_date(value)[source]

Function to verify if a string represents a calendar date (6 digits format, e.g. 14.05.93 -> refer to a date from year 93); the separator can be “.”, “-”, “/” :param value: string value :return: bool value, true for calendar date, false otherwise :rtype: build-in python bool

Verifies if a string is a valid fraction

Parameters:

val – string

Returns:

bool value (True or False)

Return type:

built-in python bool

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.is_valid_resource(value)[source]

Function that checks if an url is in small notation (kind of resource), “ames.arc.nasa.gov” :param value: string value :return: bool value, true for url in small notation, false otherwise :rtype: build-in python bool

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.is_valid_url(value)[source]

Check if a given string is a valid URL/URI :param value: given string :return: bool value, true for URL, false otherwise :rtype: build-in python bool

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.lemmatize_spacy_tokens(tokens)[source]

Apply lemmatization for a list of words.

Parameters:

tokens – the input list with words; every element is a spacy.tokens.token.Token object

Returns:

a list constructed from the initial one but every with is lemmatized (converted to base form)

Return type:

built-in python list, every element is a spacy.tokens.token.Token object

Remove excessive white spaces like “ “, “

“, “ “ from the beginning and ending of text

the given text without spaces

return:

string

rtype:

built-in python string

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.remove_spacy_punctuations(tokens)[source]

Remove all the punctuations from the given text

Parameters:

tokens – the input list that contains all the words and punctuations

Returns:

a list with all words, without punctuations;

Return type:

built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.remove_str_tokens_len_less_than_threshold(tokens, threshold_value)[source]

Remove all str tokens that have the length smaller than a threshold value :param tokens: list of str tokens :param threshold_value: a minim value for the length of a token :return: modified list of str tokens that excludes tokens of length smaller than threshold :rtype: built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.spacy_tokens_pos(tokens)[source]

Creates a list of tuples with every token and it’s frequency

Parameters:

tokens – list of spacy tokens

Returns:

list of tuples that contains the token, and it’s position

Return type:

built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.spacy_tokens_to_str_tokens(tokens)[source]

Transform a list of spacy tokens in a list of the equivalent str entities :param tokens: list of spacy tokens :return: new list of spacy tokens :rtype: built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.split_and_gather_str_tokens_by_separator(tokens, separator)[source]

Splits all tokens that contains words split by a given separator (e.g. ‘tech,media’ which is a single token becomes after splitting by ‘,’ the tokens ‘tech’, ‘media’) :param tokens: list of str tokens :param separator: a given separator such as ‘,’ :return: new list of str tokens that contains all tokens split by separator :rtype: build-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_6digits_dates_to_date_tag(tokens)[source]

Function that replace a 6 digit date with a ‘c_date’ tag :param tokens: list of str token :return: new list of str tokens with all apparitions of 6 digit date replaced with ‘c_date’ tag :rtype: build-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_currency_to_spoken_words(tokens)[source]

Transform all currency values to their equivalent in text :param tokens: list of str tokens :return: modified list of str tokens that contains all currency values in text :rtype: built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_dates_to_date_tag(tokens)[source]

Reconstruct the list of str token replacing the valid dates with a specific tag :param tokens: list of str tokens :return: new list of str tokens with instances of [date] instead of the date :rtype: built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_emails_to_email_tag(tokens)[source]

Replaces all email addresses with ‘[email]’ tag constant value :param tokens: list of str tokens :return: new list of str tokens with instances of a tag ‘email’ (constant) instead of email address :rtype: built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_fraction_to_spoken_words(tokens)[source]

Transform all numerical fraction included in tokens in their equivalent text (this produce some chained tokens, e.g ‘one-half’ and not ‘one’ ‘half’) :param tokens: list of str tokens :return: modified list of str tokens that includes numerical fractions in text :rtype: built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_initial_case_to_tag(tokens)[source]

Function that replace initial case letters (e.g. “a.”, “F.”) to a specific tag :param tokens: list of str tokens :return: new list of str token with the appearances of initial case letter replaced with tag :rtype: build-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_number_with_separators_to_integer_number(val)[source]

Transform a string that represents a number with a comma to a number without commas/integer (e.g. “10,500,205” -> 10500205) :param val: string value :return: integer :rtype: build-in python integer

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_numeric_values_to_spoken_words(tokens)[source]

Transform all numerical values to their equivalent in text :param tokens: list of str tokens :return: modified list of str tokens that contains all numerical values in text :rtype: built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_ordinal_numbers_to_spoken_words(tokens)[source]

Transform all ordinal values to their equivalent in text :param tokens: list of str tokens :return: modified list of str tokens that contains all ordinal values in text :rtype: built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_remove_common_chars(tokens)[source]

Remove all common chars such as ‘’ and ‘”’ from tokens list :param tokens: list of str tokens :return: modified list of str tokens that excludes common chars :rtype: built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_remove_junk_spaces(tokens)[source]

Removes junk spaces from a list of string tokens

Parameters:

tokens – list of string tokens

Returns:

list of tokens without junk spaces

Return type:

built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_tokens_numbers_with_separators_to_spoken_words(tokens)[source]

Function that converts the numbers that contain separators to spoken words, e.g “10,500,205” to spoken words (appending them to the list) [“ten”, “million”, “five”, “hundred”, “thousand”, “two”, “hundred”, “and”, “five”] :param tokens: list of str tokens :return: new list that contains the numbers with separators as spoken words :rtype: built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_tokens_remove_stopwords(tokens)[source]

Removes stopwords (defined also in this file) from a list of tokens

Parameters:

tokens – list of words; every element is a spacy.tokens.token.Token object

Returns:

a list constructed from the initial one without the stopwords

Return type:

built-in python list, every element is a spacy.tokens.token.Token object

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_tokens_replace_symbol_with_tag(tokens, symbol, tag)[source]

Function that replace a given symbol with a given tag (mention: structures such as ‘“cat’ will be converted into ‘[QUOTE] cat’) :param tokens: list of str tokens :param symbol: the symbol that wants to be modified :param tag: the tag that will replace the symbol value :return: new list of tokens with tag instances instead of symbol :rtype: built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_tokens_to_spacy_tokens(tokens, nlp_model)[source]

Transform a list of str tokens in a list of the equivalent spacy entities :param tokens: list of str tokens :param nlp_model: what kind of modifier we want to use :return: new list of str tokens that includes spacy tokens :rtype: built-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_tokens_to_str(tokens)[source]

Transform a list of str token in a string equivalent :param tokens: list of str tokens :return: string :rtype: built-in python string

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_urls_to_url_tag(tokens)[source]

Function that replace URL with specific tag :param tokens: list of str tokens :return: new list of str tokens with URL instances replaced with tag :rtype: build-in python list

src.main.text_preprocessing_utilities.str_years_to_spoken_words(tokens)[source]

Transform the numerical years in their equivalent text :param tokens: list of str tokens :return: modified list of str tokens that has all numerical year instances transformed in their equivalent text :rtype: built-in python list
